about:
Boxtoppers began the day I ran out of wrapping paper. Needing to wrap a present in a hurry, I searched around the house and found one sheet of white tissue paper and piece of twine. Earlier that week I had made turquoise beads for a bracelet, and decided that I would tie a bead to the middle of the present. It looked so simple and elegant that soon I began tying these delicate beads on all my gifts. Shortly after beads came miniatures - tiny character cars, sock monkeys, pumpkins, dinosaurs, ballerina bunnies, party-pooper penguins and more. These adorable little creatures sit on top of boxes, adding life and character to presents.

On a personal note, I have always been into making things out of clay, but I never thought I would ever try to sell any of it. It was more of a hobby. The reason I started Boxtoppers and chose to sell the things I was making was to help my cousin, Kathryn Moreland. Kathryn is four and a half years old, and loves music, water, laughing, playing with her older brother, looking through books, chocolate cake, and animals.

Kathryn also has autism. This neurological disorder affects the functioning of the brain, causing problems with communication, behavior, sensory input and learning.

Her parents have done many things to help their daughter, but they want to be able to help her more and give her the opportunity to live a better life. After much research, my aunt and uncle decided that an Autism Service Dog would benefit Kathryn in ways that nothing else could compare. A service dog can improve upon several issues that arise when raising a child with Autism, including: Improve Safety, Promote Social Skills, Give a "Meltdown" Focal Point, and Provide Consistency.

All Purpose Canines Inc. is an agency dedicated to "making a difference". Their mission statement matches our hopes: To provide individuals with special needs a properly trained service dog to help improve their quality of life, enhance their independence and reach their fullest potential.

The cost of training and delivering a dog is over $14,000.00. This is why I started Boxtoppers.

I believe that when people receive a gift with one of these critters sitting on top, they will feel good knowing that they are helping a little girl live a better life.

I hope that during this busy holiday season you will take a moment and pick up a few of these delightful Boxtoppers.

Thank you, from all of us.

--malena
